findings.lower_chest: 5 mm peripheral nodule in the left lower lobe, unchanged from prior

abdomen.hepatobiliary: Homogenous attenuation throughout liver with diffuse hypodensity, compatible with hepatic steatosis. No focal lesions or biliary dilatation. Gallbladder surgically absent.
abdomen.pancreas: Normal attenuation throughout without focal lesions or pancreatic ductal dilatation. No peripancreatic stranding.
abdomen.spleen: Normal size and attenuation without focal lesions.
abdomen.urinary: Normal and symmetric kidneys with normal nephrogram. No nephrolithiasis, ureterolithiasis, hydronephrosis, or perinephric abnormality. A subcentimeter hypodensity in the lower pole of the left kidney too small to characterize.
abdomen.gastrointestinal: Unremarkable stomach. Small bowel loops normal. Dilated appendix measuring up to 13 mm with significant fat stranding at the tip and a potential extraluminal appendicolith.
abdomen.lymph_nodes: Multiple enlarged mesenteric and retroperitoneal lymph nodes. Some increased in size: lateral caval lymph node measures 2.8 x 3.0 cm (previously 3.6 x 2.2 cm). Others decreased in size: left upper quadrant lymph node measures 1.6 x 2.4 cm (previously 1.8 x 3.1 cm) and right lower quadrant lymph node 0.7 x 1.3 cm (previously 1.1 x 1.5 cm).
abdomen.vascular: No abdominal aortic aneurysm. Mild atherosclerotic disease noted.
abdomen.bones: No evidence of worrisome osseous lesions or acute fracture. Mild to moderate multilevel degenerative changes of lower thoracic and upper lumbar spine.
abdomen.soft_tissues: Abdominal and pelvic wall within normal limits.

radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Enlarged lymph nodes show both increases and decreases in size: lateral caval lymph node increased, others decreased.
